intro: Cleisostoma cornutum, commonly known as the horned cleisostoma, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae and is characterized by its unique, spurred flowers that resemble horns. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in humid tropical environments. Its leaves are usually ovate and革质, providing structural support and aiding in water retention. The flowers bloom in clusters, often displaying a combination of white and green hues, and are pollinated by specific insect species.
